page.title: 05Old School at Cookley Green
page.content: Until 1985 there was a small village school at Cookley Green. Because there are so few residents the school only had two teachers to teach the age range of pupils from 5-11 years. The number of pupils fell during the last few years until there was only one class and one teacher. Most of the pupils were children of gypsies camping near by; because of their nomadic life their level of edu- cation was poor. Local people with children of school age began to take their children away from this school and send them to a Primary School in Nettlebed, 4 miles distant, objecting to the general behaviour of the gipsy children. Eventually the school was closed because of lack of pupils. The old school building is now being con- verted into a private house.
